alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Bullock; Elmore; Macon; Montgomery; Pike; Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 11:21AM CDT until April 05 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Pike County in southeastern Alabama... Southeastern Elmore County in east central Alabama... Bullock County in southeastern Alabama... Macon County in southeastern Alabama... Eastern Montgomery County in south central Alabama... Barbour County in southeastern Alabama... Russell County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 1245 PM CDT. * At 1120 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Waugh to 8 miles southeast of Glenwood, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Eastern Montgomery, Columbus, Phenix City, Troy, Eufaula, Tuskegee, Tallassee, Union Springs, Brundidge, Clio, Notasulga, Hurtsboro, Midway, Goshen, Meadville, Milstead, Georgetown, Pike Road, Clayton and Louisville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Bullock; Elmore; Macon; Montgomery; Pike; Russell
